dialog: Hi, Medi. I've heard about pancreatitis in dogs. Can you provide some information?
Certainly! Pancreatitis in dogs is a condition where the pancreas becomes inflamed. It can be caused by factors like high-fat diets, obesity, certain medications, or underlying health conditions.
Are there any specific symptoms to look out for in dogs?
Yes, some common symptoms of pancreatitis in dogs include abdominal pain, vomiting, loss of appetite, diarrhea, and lethargy. If you notice these signs, it's best to consult a veterinarian.
Can it be prevented?

While pancreatitis in dogs cannot be entirely prevented, you can minimize the risk by feeding your dog a balanced diet, avoiding high-fat foods, maintaining a healthy weight, and monitoring any medications they may take.
